results.title: World of Pets
results.creator_credit: Alan Degen, Sidney Platt and National Geographic Society
results.brief_description: Each program looks at a particular pet and shows how you can learn about animal behavior through the care of animals. The programs also give tips on how to look after pets.

results.title: Catholic boys
results.creator_credit: Michael Dinner, Mark Carliner, Dan Wigutow and Silver Screen Partners
results.brief_description: Set in Brooklyn in 1965, this comedy film focuses on several Catholic school boys who get into ever increasing amounts of trouble with the presiding priests of the Catholic school, St. Basil’s. Michael is the new student who latches onto the class egghead, Caesar, who is constantly picked on by the class bully, Rooney. Rooney intimidates Michael and Caesar into becoming his erstwhile chums and, along with a few other members of the ‘gang’, they receive corporal punishment for minor infractions, disrupting communion and confession and, ultimately, their antics inspire changes in the strict school hierarchy. Cast includes: Andrew McCarthy, Mary Stuart Masterson, Kevin Dillon, Malcom Danare, Donald Sutherland, John Heard and Patrick Dempsey.

results.title: Catherine the Great: a profile in power
results.creator_credit: Arthur Voronka, Learning Corporation of America and Look Hear Productions
results.brief_description: Explores, through use of an imaginary historical interview, the life and the role of Catherine the Great of Russia. Cast includes Zoe Caldwell and Patrick Watson. Written by Patrick Withrow. Suitable for secondary school level.

results.title: Cary Grant: the leading man
results.creator_credit: Gene Feldman, Suzette Winter and Wombat Productions, Inc.
results.brief_description: Born Alexander Archibald Leech in Bristol, England 1904, the son of working class parents. Always interested in acting and the theatre, Cary rose to fame after being discovered by Mae West. Her confidence in the young man she befriended paid off when Cary overcame his humble beginnings to become a favourite Hollywood icon, whose resume of films include ‘Bringing Up Baby’, ‘An Affair to Remember’, ‘His Girl Friday’ and ‘North by Northwest’. This documentary highlights the highs and lows of his career and uses family photos, archival footage and clips from his films to show the many faces of one of Hollywood’s most admired male actors. Includes interviews with friends and colleagues including: Leslie Caron; Douglas Fairbanks Jr; Deborah Kerr; Eva Marie Saint; Ralph Bellamy; Stanley Donen; Richard Brooks and Stanley Kramer.

results.title: Carve her name with pride
results.creator_credit: Muir Mathieson, Daniel M. Angel and Rank Organisation Film Productions
results.brief_description: Based on R.J. Minney’s novel this inspiring true story of war heroine, Violette Szabo, who volunteered to be parachuted into France as a secret agent to re-organise a shattered resistance group. Virginia McKenna gives the performance of her career as the courageous secret agent, and this magnificent film ensures that no-one will forget Violette’s bravery and conviction in what she believed in most - freedom from tyranny. Also stars Paul Scofield, Jack Warner, Denise Grey and Maurice Ronet.

results.title: Cathedrale, la Ville, L'ecole = The cathedral, the city, the school
results.brief_description:
During the XIIth century, the centres of innovation are moving away from the monastries towards the cathedrals. Times are changing and what matters is now the secular world, the merchants and the bishop. Cathedrals are not simply devised for religious celebration, they are also civic centres where town meetings are held and to which the guilds of merchants contribute magnificent stainglass windows. During this period of urban revival, money flows towards the building of cathedrals in Reims, Laon, Chartres, Bourges, etc …

Credits: Director, Roland Darbois ; writers, Roger Stephane, Roland Darbois, photography, Roland Dantigny.
Cast: Narrated by Georges Duby.

results.title: Catch the Wind
results.creator_credit: University of Western Australia and University of Western Australia. Human Movement and Recreation Studies Department
results.brief_description: Catch the Wind is a guide to dinghy sailing designed for instructors, schools, sail-training institutes and beginners. It is designed to provide a thorough and entertaining introduction to the basics of sailing.

results.title: Catch 'em being good (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Ron Friedman, Marlene Schneider and Synergetic Productions
results.brief_description: Instructional film for teachers demonstrating various approaches to motivating and disciplining students in the classroom. Shows methods for teachers to get the best out of their students, particularly the more difficult ones.

results.title: CATARACT (concrete)
results.credit_line:
Daniel von Sturmer. Aotearoa New Zealand

Aluminium structure, LCD screens, HD video. Indefinite loop

Commissioned by ACMI
results.material_description: Multi-channel installation, aluminium structure, LCD screens, HD video
results.brief_description: Everyday moments of existence are presented across 60 screens as a complex cacophony of events in CATARACT (concrete). This dynamic and overwhelming assemblage reflects the abundance of moments and messages we encounter in the world, which is represented as a complex and synthesised totality.

constellations_primary.name: Now watch this
constellations_primary.description: In a video-saturated world, how do you keep focus? Do you keep a close eye on one thing, or step back and watch the parade of images go by, to see the whole thing?

results.headline_credit_for_label:
Australia, 2020

Aluminium structure, LCD screens, HD video. Indefinite loop.
results.description:
Exploding fireworks, bubbles in the atmosphere, an untouched swimming pool.

Small everyday moments of existence are presented across 60 screens as a complex cacophony of events in CATARACT (concrete). This dynamic and overwhelming assemblage of images reflects the abundance of moments and messages we encounter in the world, which is represented as a complex and synthesised totality. But with so much happening, how do we focus on a singular experience and create meaning?

That is the central question von Sturmer raises in this multi-screen work, which uses impromptu recordings and tabletop experiments to invite the viewer to negotiate between singular moments and discordant fragments of experience.
description_for_label:
Exploding fireworks, bubbles in the atmosphere, an untouched swimming pool.

But with so much happening, how do we focus on a singular experience and create meaning?

That is the central question von Sturmer raises in this multi-screen work, which uses impromptu recordings and tabletop experiments to invite the viewer to negotiate between singular moments and discordant fragments of experience.
